document_data.mainbody: '''''Slow''''' (originally '''''Quantoul's slowmorph''''' and [[mindwitness]]es, had innate magical abilities that mimicked this spell. [[Ocular adept]]s, [[humanoid]] servants of the [[Great Mother]], the [[beholder]] goddess, also had the power of ''slow''.
document_data.Effects:
One or more creatures within close range both from the caster and each other were magically made slower in their actions and reflexes. Targets with high strength of will could resist the effects of the spell, which otherwise lasted for about a third of a minute or longer.

Several spells countered or negated the effects of this spell, including ''[[haste]]'', ''[[freedom]]'', ''[[freedom of movement]]'',
document_data.Components: The spell required [[Verbal component|verbal]] and [[somatic component]]s and a drop of molasses.
document_data.History: The spell was invented by prolific [[Netherese arcanist]] [[Quantoul]] in {{Yearlink|-2026}} (1833 NY). It was also recorded in the ''[[Book of Bats]]''.
